title.narrative: VIOLENCE:PROTECTION OF CHILDREN FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children and adolescents live in safer environments, where they are increasingly protected from violence and exploitation.

related-activity.ref: 2850/A0/06/883 PROTECTION OF CHILDREN FROM VIOLENCE AND EXPLOITATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened capacities to provide child protection services and prevent violence. ;4,080 child victims of violence were reached with child protection services, 7,169 with life skills programs and 18,848 adults through a positive parenting campaign. 251 women and 296 children were provided with temporary shelter through collaboration with the hospitality sector. Violence prevention social service competency standards were adopted by DIF. Training materials for first responders were developed, reaching 132 workers and 1,050 911 operators in all 32 states. A study on feminicide was published along with an awareness raising campaign for girls on GBV service availability and prevention. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:28/01/2022
